com.google.gwt.dev.shell
Class CheckForUpdates

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.dev.shell.CheckForUpdates
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckForUpdatesIE6
public class CheckForUpdates
extends java.lang.Object

Orchestrates a best-effort attempt to find out if a new version of GWT is available.

Nested Class Summary
static interface CheckForUpdates.UpdateResult
          Returns the result of an update check.

Constructor Detail

CheckForUpdates

public CheckForUpdates(TreeLogger logger,
                       java.lang.String entryPoint)
Create an update checker which will poll a server URL and log a message about an update if available.

Parameters:
logger - TreeLogger to use
entryPoint - the name of the main entry point used for this execution

check

public CheckForUpdates.UpdateResult check()
Check for updates and log to the logger if they are available.

Returns:
an UpdateResult or null if there is no new update

check

public CheckForUpdates.UpdateResult check(long minCheckMillis)
Check for updates and log to the logger if they are available.

Returns:
an UpdateResult or null if there is no new update

doHttpGet

protected byte[] doHttpGet(TreeLogger branch,
                           java.lang.String userAgent,
                           java.lang.String url)
Default implementation just uses the platform-independent method. A subclass should override this method for platform-dependent proxy handling, for example.

Parameters:
branch - TreeLogger to use
userAgent - user agent string to send in request
url - URL to fetch
Returns:
byte array of response, or null if an error

httpGetNonNative

protected byte[] httpGetNonNative(TreeLogger branch,
                                  java.lang.String userAgent,
                                  java.lang.String url)
This default implementation uses regular Java HTTP, which doesn't deal with proxies automagically. See the IE6 subclasses for an implementation that does deal with proxies.

Parameters:
branch - TreeLogger to use
userAgent - user agent string to send in request
url - URL to fetch
Returns:
byte array of response, or null if an error
